text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Monday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Ruling party officials say Zairean refugees in the northern Mpulungu district have smuggled in many firearms and ammunition.
- The investment centre complains that inadequate funding from government has made donors sceptical about supporting the institution which enjoys only lukewarm government attention.
- Government, assisted by the United States AID, is to investigate the possible causes of early disintegration of road works completed two years ago.
- Ruling party parliamentarian Yona Shimonde has died, bringing to three the number of MPs to have died in just two weeks.
- The farmers union has accused the government of causing confusion amongst farmers because of policy inconsistencies.
- The manufacturers association has warned the government that Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines ZCCM.PA may collapse if it is not quickly privatised.
